intro: Cordia petta-pelioporet, commonly known as the Malabar redwood, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its reddish bark and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forest areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
